text.__SUMMARY__: Helicotylenchus dihystera (Steiner's spiral nematode) is a plant pathogenic nematode. It is known to inhabit sugarcane, rice, potatoes, corn, peanut, millet, sorghum, banana and forest trees.
text.See also: Sodium azide - used for agricultural control of Helicotylenchus dihystera
text.External links: Nemaplex, University of California - Helicotylenchus dihystera
